title: Drawing, "Design for a Cup", 1936
medium: Pen and black ink, brown ink, graphite on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower center: COUPE, lower right: J.P./36/(square root sign) 2.
dimensions: 40.2 X 20.2 cm (17 5/8 X 12 3/16 in.), irregular sheet
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description: Cylindrical cup flaring at the top drawn in plan and elevation. The cup supported on two inverted saucer-shaped bases indicated in brown ink separated by a wide silver band and flanked by an applied band grooved on the outer edge conforming to the contour of the base. Underdrawing in graphite of cup in golden section.
